The whole situation with the PVE. I wasn't really interested in the PVE anyways, but still...
I will not support this any longer.

Like many of you reading these reviews, I was once a huge fan of Overwatch. I had the Origins Edition preorder and was there at midnight on release day, loading into Hanamura and signing away my gaming life for the next year at minimum. From the incredibly fun cast of characters, to the great map design, to the instantly iconic music and sound design, to the consistently rewarding (albeit somewhat controversial) progression system, it quickly became one of my favourite multiplayer games ever made. If it was released on Steam in 2016, it would easily be in the top 5 most played games on my account. I eventually moved on as I grew tired of the competitive grind, but became super excited to return to the game with the announcement of the sequel offering substantial PvE content.

And then the sequel finally dropped last year…and they dropped the ball with it. Jeff Kaplan clearly jumped ship for a reason.

The promised story campaign, endlessly replayable PvE missions, and talent trees for each character, were all pretty much cancelled in their entirety, with the community informed far too late in the process. The single main reason for this game having a 2 slapped onto it in the first place will no longer come to fruition, so what’s the reason for it being called Overwatch 2? Outside of the new 5v5 standard, and the typical live-service hero, map and mode additions, the core of the game is essentially the same as what was originally released all those years ago. 

I guess there is some PvE content in this invasion update, but the main part of it is locked behind a £13 paywall, and there’ll probably be more £13 segments of this campaign locked behind future paywalls. With so many incredible games out there still to play, I cannot foresee myself dropping the cash to experience what is essentially a fraction of a campaign that games less than this cost of entry would provide in full and then some. Why would I spend money on this when I could buy incredible games like Skyrim, Doom Eternal, Papers Please, Disco Elysium and Mafia for far less?

Outside of sports releases, Call of Duty and Ubisoft games, sequels to beloved games usually come with substantial additions and advancements building on the foundation of that original entry. It is an insult to the legitimate sequels out there that this game is still being referred to as a second entry in a franchise. The only substantial change I can see relates to how the game handles progression and monetization, and this is a straight-up downgrade from how it was handled in Overwatch 1. It has become yet another F2P live service where the most exciting content comes in a time-limited Battle Pass, where all items are unlocked in a linear fashion and require a substantial time investment to make the most of your purchase. 

This exhausting, creatively bankrupt trend is disintegrating the interest that many people have in modern AAA shooters, as it turns every game that has one from being a fun past time into essentially a secondary job. Blizzard even had the audacity to lock the latest heroes past the halfway point of the free battle pass track (changed to Unlock 1 if you pay up), meaning everyone will not have access to the full hero roster at all times, a truly fatal error in a game where a good portion of the strategy is based around hero synergy and effective counter-picks. 

All of this pains me to write, as the game still remains incredibly fun to play all these years later. The foundation of the game is brilliant, even if not much has changed. But I just cannot excuse how shamefully Blizzard has handled this “sequel” to one of the most revered multiplayer shooters of the 2010s. I know it’s popular to refer to Overwatch as one of the many in the line of dead live service games, but I don’t think it deserves that placement yet. Games have come back from far worse states than what Overwatch 2 is currently in. I hope Blizzard is having a serious chat behind the scenes, looking at the fan backlash received over the past few months, in particular with this Steam release, to see what needs to be done to make things right. They can only rely on the support of fans with a high sunk-cost fallacy and new players oblivious to the game’s previous greatness for so long.

I’ll return to the game to try out some of the seasonal modes I’ve missed, but outside of that, Blizzard won’t be getting a dime out of me, and not much time out of me until they at least make the PvE a competent experience, as was promised when Overwatch 2 was first announced. I hope that my perception towards this game will become more positive over time, but Blizzard has a lot of work to do to make that happen.

Cztery lata. Cztery walone lata zajęło blizzardowi podmiana numeru i spierdzielenie balansu. Mnóstwo postaci stało się useless np. Smuga zadaje malutki damage, więc musi mocno podejść do wroga, aby go zranić lecz ma tak mało hp, że kiedy już zdąży zadać sensowniejszy damage to umiera. Dodatkowo większość postaci trzeba odblokować przez co niektóre nasze mainy z 1 części są dostępne od razu a niektóre trza odblokować długim graniem, albo płacąc realny hajs. A co do realnego hajsu to blizzard pokazał nam wielkiego, środkowego palca. Wyłączył serwery 1 części tylko po to aby zmusić nas do grania w tą samą grę tylko z zepsutym balansem. 25 euro psu w odbyt poszło. A najgorsze jest to jak się kliknie w opcję personalizacji growego profilu to tam są arkana ciemności. Mnóstwo profili i banerów o tematyce LGBT. Na co to komu? Gra przeszła proces zlewacenia dając ogromną paletę awatarów dla gejów. Na co to komu? Gejom co są tak nudni, że opierają cały swój charakter i osobowość na byciu gejem? To jak i cała 2 część tej gry to zwykła żenada. Tak jak nam blizzard pokazał środkowego palca, tak my musimy mu go pokazać.

曾经，有一份特别好吃的饭，我和同学天天吃，从未觉得得腻味；放学不是回家，而是去饭店里点上这份饭，慢慢品味手中珍馐；同时，也会遇到志同道合之人，我们互相谈论手中的美味，开心着，沉迷着。
  慢慢的，吃这家饭的人多了起来。而一手建立起的是为食客着想的饭店的几位店长，却一个一个突然离开了，我们发现这里的饭逐渐变了口味，已经不再是我们熟悉的味道，仿佛加了火药一般，偶尔吃的时候还有点恶心，但我仍然喜爱着这份饭，因为它承载着我的青春，我的回忆。
  突然，有一天，不知道从哪里冒出来的老鼠，在这个饭店里肆意破坏，连带着其他几家饭店也都遭了殃，店员却还苦苦支撑着，只为了不辜负这个饭店与食客，但是，这里的鼠灾肆虐，已经严重到无法继续经营，店员们决定将食客们充值的金额返还，放弃这家饭店，尽管食客们依依不舍，但还是不能改变那个结局。
  饭店最终还是没能保住，食客们依依不舍，因为，这是他们的青春，他们的回忆。他们痛骂着，唾弃着，狠不得把老鼠千刀万剐！可是，却也是只能发泄心中愤怒。
  食客们有些已经放弃，有些还在苦苦寻求曾经的快乐，虽然说，每个人都有自己新的选择，但，我相信，他们心中始终有同一个想法：“暴雪好死，你妈的孤儿考迪克，有人生没人养的畜生，天天想着赚你妈的黑心钱，户口本是只有你一个人了干你妈的这种缺德事情，你他妈的这辈子不要到中国来，来了他妈的口水都能淹死你全家，傻逼玩意儿，早点滚去下地狱去吧！”---来自一位伤心的守望 炉石玩家
对得起我们吗！退钱！

Nearly everything in Overwatch 2 is a downgrade, from the switch to 5V5 making the game both more frustrating in solo queue and less interesting in a party alongside the erosion of tanking, to the progression being a paid feature retroactively making all of Overwatch 1's collecting gone and the removal of defining multiplayer-FPS maps of the 2010s like Hanamura & Volskaya.
Its garbage content salvaged for Kotick & Activision-Blizzard to milk every last drop out of the dumpster that was Overwatch 2's development. 

Blizzard learned their lesson from WoW Classic when they cried because people would rather play the defining game from 2004 than settle for their watered down live version. 
The original game that was so critically acclaimed (An overstatement in retrospect imo) is now lost, and this is what remains. Without dedicated server support, Blizzard get the final say, and as long as people settle their greed will continue to infest and ruin their genuinely good IPs.
OW1 won't be the last defining multiplayer title lost to time.

The original game had a mountain of problems, but at least, at its core, it was a unique FPS that could be full of teamwork and counterplay. Overwatch 2 lacks any of the teamplay that set Overwatch apart, while being devoid of anything resembling good movement or gunplay that more individual-focused hero shooters, such as Apex, has.
I had far more fun during Overwatch 1's 'maintenance mode' than I have during Overwatch 2, More content does not mean better, especially when its as half-baked as most of Overwatch 2's additions.

Overwatch 2 is just another attempt from Blizzard to force fans to settle for mediocrity for the sake of their own greed.  
A complete and total waste.

Alright! Heres the deal. I've played well over 4k hours across console and pc on and off many accounts before steam.

I die hard grinded comp for most of my playtime. I've achieved Top500 multiple times. And without letting my accs decay I'm pretty much always GM. 
I'm a Junkrat Main, Riptide! If you ask around any OW1 gm west coasters I'm sure you'll get some ranting >:)

I can tell you without thinking twice. Going competitive is what kills any sort of fun you MAY have in this game. (Unless you're a competitive person or like to improve at things) The most fun recently I had is playing QP with my friend typing "c9" in chat when its not a c9 play and laughing our asses off when people start getting mad over it. 

If you want to enjoy this game, play it as a party game. FOR FUN | WITH FRIENDS
Even still, I can never recommend it. I would recommend you instead get on TF2 and go play casual. (Its a million times easier to get rid of bots in a semi populated server than it is to have fun vs sweaty players in OW)

ALSO, if you've played ANY traditional FPS game. OLDER ONES, not only CoD. For some reason, this game's community perception on skill when it comes to mechanics is a z z backwards. 

Typically hitscan is always easy and anyone can do (still is here) and projectile is harder (still is). The main difference is that this game is more team/mobility required so vs newbies/noobies you get to be really lazy as projectile. 

So trying to play with randoms when you come from other games may very well be SEVERELY HEADACHE INDUCING.

So I won't lie and say that there's absolutely NOTHING worth of value here, cause there is. It's just hidden behind a pile of greed, bad decisions, and a crap company. I played Overwatch from 2017-2019 or so and I loved it but it got to the point where the balance issues just couldn't be fixed so I stopped and only recently came back to it and it's honestly disgusting the direction they've taken with the game. "Since the game isn't as popular as it used to be lets milk what we can from it and leave it in perpetual hell" is all I feel when playing it. The money grubbing relationship that Blizzard has towards their players along with them legitimately lying about their products AND with how they treat their employees and such I wouldn't recommend playing this at all unless it's to leave a review of your own.

我觉得界徐盛的需要加强了，他绝对不是无脑角色，首先我们界徐盛玩家需要打开《三国杀》这款软件，我认为这个步骤对于我们界徐盛玩家来说是十分困难的。其次打开游戏后还需要点击开始游戏，我认为这步真的难如上青天，并且需要花费玩家大量时间来进行一个等待。开局后我们还要刷手气卡，这一步对于玩家的手速有极大考验，如果想攻击对面，我们界徐盛玩家就必须点击并使用一张杀，这及其考验玩家的思维能力和反应能力，并且仅仅只能造成两点伤害，甚至还要一一点击才能盖住对方手牌，这一步不仅仅考验手速，更是在考验玩家对牌的名字到底叫什么的准确性，最后如果手里有酒和古锭刀，界徐盛必须要自己上刀，自己喝酒，甚至还需要谨慎的确认使用顺序，这对于玩家的手部骨骼和古锭刀刀刃锋利度都会有极大的影响。综上所述，我认为界徐盛算t5行列，需要加强，向所有逆版本而行的界徐盛玩家致敬。

              那麼我们告诉你这贱种，你别以为能养育些个信基督的种猪。现在我们做个了断，我们就不知道时日也没有个历法；因为那银月高挂天上，时年就在书中，这裏的日头和那裏的日头还是一个天！就为了这个你舔我们的屁股去吧！

The DLC* Overwatch 2 certainly hasn't been shining between other games of its published time. As someone who played a lot of Overwatch I am also missing the good ol' 6v6 as it allowed the game to embrace much more chaos within its matches.
While the gameplay itself doesn't bother me as much, the threatened relation to customers in combination to their monetization is comparable to a truck driving you over. (If only a thorn in the eye was enough)

In case of customer relations the devs/publishers(/whoever needs to be pointed at) have done nothing more than kicking their playerbase throughout the entire time since release. First they decided to strip every former customer of their game to force them into "a new game" (usually people tend to create a seperate game in their shop for this). Afterwards they announce that barely anything of the things they promised (see all those promised PvE contents) gets into the new game although it was the reason that development of the first game stopped. :/

The turn of monetization hit harder than Overwatch v1.0 Roadhog players. From one-time buying a game (and possible lootbox buying) new people get forced to pay up to the same price of AAA games for a likely desired skin for a character.

After all, I am having a hard time giving this game more attention as I just cannot trust them to not delete entire progresses of players or wreak havoc with their accounts in any other way as they don't seem to hesitate with those kinds of actions.
People that didn't start with this game are highly advised to turn away before getting hooked on the concept and missing their wallet when starting to envy fashion of overpriced skins.

*The game isn't worthier than a DLC to me considering the barely noticable amount of differences to the first game when released.

猫

从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。

后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，可是它挣脱我，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走，还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了.....

后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受，
可是我不会再要它了
。

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Overwatch 2 is the epitome of everything New Blizzard is and Old Blizzard isn't. A once promising and innovative game hollowed out into a soulless FOMO-driven predatory cash grab, aggressively monetized all to make Bobby Kotick's fourth yacht just a little bigger. And in case you're wondering where else that Battle Pass revenue is going, it's spent kowtowing to any and every authoritarian regime necessary to protect the ActiBlizz stock price (RIP Blitzchung). 

I've easily spent 2000+ hours in Overwatch 1 in the Battle.net client, and a fresh coat of paint in the Steam store isn't gonna do much to make up for what Overwatch 2 has become. Maybe the Microsoft acquisition will change things someday, but until then you're better off spending your time building a time machine to go back and play when Jeff Kaplan was in charge.

先说我要写一段差评，但是差评的原因并不是国服关了。

没错，我也是一名国服受害者，但是我并没有变成国际服避难者，甚至可以说我早在守望2出之前就差不多不想玩了，所以我想和大家说，别忘了，虽然国服关了搞得大家非常难受，但是游戏方面他也整的一塌糊涂呀！

差评第一部分给到失败的阵容调整。

六人改五人，是非常离谱的一个调整。之前的强行222我觉得还强点，减少了玩家的选择，但是没有非常巨大的变革，娱乐性确实少了，但是只能说不算成功，不能说完全失败，起码算是为了游戏平衡做出了努力，游戏整体的对抗和之前还是差不多的思路。但是六改五不一样，坦克变成一个，不说职业玩家战队的变化，就仅作为普通玩家来看待这件事，坦克的减少带来的是坦克位整体增强，这势必会改变游戏的重心，导致从6v6变成1+4v1+4，这绝对不是简单的人数变化，甚至可以说变了个游戏。坦克位不光承伤还能打输出，干脆改名叫队长位好了。以前某个位置有人打的不好，没关系，其他位置一定程度上会帮助弥补缺陷，输出不够那坦克和奶给你提供输出环境和容错率，坦度不够我们可以更快的消灭对方或者多奶两口，奶不够抱团或者大哥先点掉对面输出位也能将就。5v5呢，坦克打得好不好直接决定游戏走向。坦克死了，输出和承伤都一下子少了一大截。非要说平衡不，也平衡，两边都一样嘛，但是整个游戏的重心和玩法都大变样，暴雪你明明有很多种办法调整阵容和人数，结果直接最简单粗暴的砍一个职能位再增强剩下的，那我moba砍了中路然后上路近可ad远可ap血还厚的要死就好玩了？我也有一年没玩了，不知道现在是不是进行了调整，如果有所改变或者大家实战中觉得没有那么离谱那这一条属于我理解不到位。

差评第二部分给到运营。

首先守望1可是买断制游戏，守望2当时宣传的主打是pve部分，结果出了2告诉我pve还在做，pvp还是我们的核心啦，改了改建模改了改阵容这就是守望先锋2啦，也不是没有更新，我们免费啦！还推出了通行证系统，以后新英雄不打通行证你就用不了啦，是不是很棒？新玩家虽然免费开玩，但是要解锁英雄，老玩家以后新的皮肤解锁也和新玩家一样麻烦，以前的金币统统大贬值，虽然你们的金币贬值了，但是我们居然把老玩家的英雄和皮肤都保留到2里了，真伟大！
所以我们期待了很久的守望2，pve战役，就变成了一次版本更新，还是付费转免费的更新，真的好不爽。虽然现在我看到有战役和剧情线，但是这玩意去年就该端上来了，已经是耍玩家玩了一次了。所以守望先锋2，还是守望先锋归来，叫什么都好，我看不出来搞个大更新的意义，你要作为续作或者重启你给足内容啊，满汉全席你等人入席了结果就端个原材料过来就说可以先吃着菜帮子猪正在后厨杀呢你看食客打不打你。

综上，不带国服这事我就已经一肚子不满了，国服停服是压倒骆驼的最后一座金字塔，这个差评我打的理直气壮，不仅为停服，不仅为暴雪教我玩游戏，不仅为傻逼烤迪克，而是为了我再也回不来的七年，和2016年我永远怀念的那个夏天。

我仍然记得2016年的夏天，尚且年幼的我缠着父母给我买了守望先锋，那么精彩的世界引得无数人静静等待他的出世，前赴后继的成为守望世界的英雄。等待是美好的，开服后的时光更是美好的，天国的散，还是辅助的阿三，还要砸三级炮台的托比昂，还不是逃兵的76。
但是回不来了，就像烤迪克的亲妈一样，消散在记忆里了。
今天我们收到了召唤，但是我累了，先锋不再是从前的先锋了（除非凯德真的复活那么我会给隔壁土命2打call接着去隔壁的先锋继续打工而且看情况说不定预告里的真是凯德哈哈），直布罗陀已经消失在地平线下，我的心里只能容得下以前那个美好的守望先锋了
